Demo Besar-besaran Berlanjut, Presiden Chile Tegaskan Tak Akan Mundur
06 Nov 2019, 09:20 by Novi Christiastuti
Santiago - Presiden Chile, Sebastian Pinera, menegaskan tidak akan mundur dari jabatannya meskipun tengah menghadapi unjuk rasa besar-besaran. Unjuk rasa yang memprotes ketidaksetaraan dan buruknya kondisi sosial di Chile itu telah memasuki minggu ketiga.
Seperti dilansir AFP, Rabu (6/11/2019), penegasan itu disampaikan Pinera dalam wawancara terbaru dengan media Inggris, BBC.
Saat ditanya apakah dirinya akan mundur dari jabatannya, Pinera dengan yakin menjawab: "Tidak."
"Persoalan-persoalan ini telah berakumulasi selama 30 tahun terakhir. Saya bertanggung jawab atas sebagian dari itu dan saya menganggapnya sebagai tanggung jawab saya, tapi bukan hanya saya satu-satunya (yang bertanggung jawab)," tegas Pinera.
Bentrokan kembali pecah dalam unjuk rasa pada Selasa (5/11) waktu setempat, yang semakin memperburuk situasi di salah satu negara paling makmur di kawasan Amerika Latin ini. Unjuk rasa besar-besaran memaksa pemerintah Chile membatalkan dua acara besar, yakni APEC dan KTT Perubahan Iklim.
Ribuan demonstran turun ke jalanan ibu kota Santiago dan di kota-kota lainnya seperti Concepcion dan Vina del Mar, sebelah barat Santiago.

text:
Large-scale demonstrations continue, Chile's president confirms he will not back down
Nov 6 2019, 09:20 by Novi Christiastuti
Santiago - President of Chile, Sebastian Pinera, insisted he would not resign from office despite facing massive demonstrations. The demonstration protesting inequality and the poor social conditions in Chile has entered its third week.
As reported by AFP on Wednesday (11/06/2019), the affirmation was conveyed by Pinera in a recent interview with British media, BBC.
When asked whether he would step down from his post, Pinera confidently replied: "No."
"These problems have accumulated over the past 30 years. I am responsible for a part of it and I consider it my responsibility, but I am not the only one (responsible)," said Pinera.
Clashes broke out again in a rally on Tuesday (11/5) local time, which further worsened the situation in one of the most prosperous countries in the Latin American region. Massive demonstrations forced the Chilean government to cancel two major events, namely the APEC and the Climate Change Summit.
Thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of the capital city of Santiago and in other cities such as Concepcion and Vina del Mar, west of Santiago.
